title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: First Vice-President U. A. P. A.]
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: United Amateur Press Association
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: EXPONENT OF AMATEUR JOURNALISM
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ITS OBJECT
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The desire to write for publication is one which inheres strongly in
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: every human breast. From the proficient college graduate, storming the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: gates of the high-grade literary magazines, to the raw schoolboy, vainly
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: endeavoring to place his first crude compositions in the local
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: newspapers, the whole intelligent public are today seeking expression
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: through the printed page, and yearning to behold their thoughts and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ideals permanently crystallized in the magic medium of type. But while a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: few persons of exceptional talent manage eventually to gain a foothold
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: in the professional world of letters rising to celebrity through the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: wide diffusion of their art, ideals, or opinions; the vast majority,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: unless aided in their education by certain especial advantages, are
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: doomed to confine their expression to the necessarily restricted sphere
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of ordinary conversation. To supply these especial educational
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: advantages which may enable the general public to achieve the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: distinction of print, and which may prevent the talented but unknown
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: author from remaining forever in obscurity, has arisen that largest and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: foremost of societies for literary education =The United Amateur Press
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Association=.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ITS ORIGIN
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Amateur journalism, or the composition and circulation of small,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: privately printed magazines, is an instructive diversion which has
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: existed in the United States for over half a century. In the decade of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: 1866-1876 this practice first became an organized institution; a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: short-lived society of amateur journalists, including the now famous
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: publisher, Charles Scribner, having existed from 1869 to 1874. In 1876 a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: more lasting society was formed, which exists to this day as an exponent
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of light dilettantism. Not until 1895, however, was amateur journalism
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: established as a serious branch of educational endeavour. On September
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: 2nd of that year, Mr. William H. Greenfield, a gifted professional
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: author, of Philadelphia, founded =The United Amateur Press Association=,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: which has grown to be the leader of its kind, and the representative of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: amateur journalism in its best phases throughout the English-speaking
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: world.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ITS NATURE
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: In many respects the word "amateur" fails to do full credit to amateur
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: journalism and the association which best represents it. To some minds
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the term conveys an idea of crudity and immaturity, yet the =United= can
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: boast of members and publications whose polish and scholarship are
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: well-nigh impeccable. In considering the adjective "amateur" as applied
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: to the press association, we must adhere to the more basic
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: interpretation, regarding the word as indicating the non-mercenary
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: nature of the membership. Our amateurs write purely for love of their
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: art, without the stultifying influence of commercialism. Many of them
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: are prominent professional authors in the outside world, but their
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: professionalism never creeps into their association work. The atmosphere
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: is wholly fraternal, and courtesy takes the place of currency.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The real essential of amateur journalism and =The United Amateur Press
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Association= is the amateur paper or magazine, which somewhat resembles
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the average high-school or college publication. These journals, varying
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: greatly in size and character, are issued by various members at their
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: own expense, and contain, besides the literary work of their several
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: editors or publishers, contributions from all the many members who do
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: not publish papers of their own. Their columns are open to every person
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: in the association, and it may be said with justice that no one will
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: find it impossible to secure the publication of any literary composition
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of reasonable brevity. The papers thus published are sent free to all
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: our many members, who constitute a select and highly appreciative
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: reading public. Since each member receives the published work of every
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: other member, many active and brilliant minds are brought into close
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: contact, and questions of every sort, literary, historical, and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: scientific, are debated both in the press and in personal
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: correspondence. The correspondence of members is one of the most
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: valuable features of the =United=, for through this medium a great
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: intellectual stimulus, friendly and informal in nature, is afforded.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Congenial members are in this way brought together in a lettered
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: companionship, which often grows into life-long friendship, while
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: persons of opposed ideas may mutually gain much breadth of mind by
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: hearing the other side of their respective opinions discussed in a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: genial manner. In short, the =United= offers an exceptionally
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: well-proportioned mixture of instruction and fraternal cheer. There are
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: no limits of age, sex, education, position, or locality in this most
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: complete of democracies. Boys and girls of twelve and men and women of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The warlike impulse put by Nature there?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Where now the gentle maxims of the school,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The cant of preachers, and the Golden Rule?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: What feeble word or doctrine now can stay
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The tribe whose fathers own'd Valhalla's sway?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Too long restrain'd, the bloody tempest breaks,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And Midgard 'neath the tread of warriors shakes.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: On to thy death, Berserker bold! And try
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: In acts of Godlike bravery to die!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Who cares to find the heaven of the priest,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: When only warriors can with Woden feast?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The flesh of Sehrimnir, and the cup of mead,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Are but for him who falls in martial deed:
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Yon luckless boor, that passive meets his end,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: May never in Valhalla's court contend.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Slay, brothers, Slay! And bathe in crimson gore;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Let Thor, triumphant, view the sport once more!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: All other thoughts are fading in the mist,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: But to attack, or if attack'd, resist.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: List, great Alfadur, to the clash of steel;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: How like a man does each brave swordsman feel!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The cries of pain, the roars of rampant rage,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: In one vast symphony our ears engage.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Strike! Strike him down! Whoever bars the way;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Let each kill many ere he die today!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Ride o'er the weak; accomplish what ye can;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The Gods are kindest to the strongest man!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Why should we fear? What greater joy than this?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Asgard alone could give us sweeter bliss!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: My strength is waning; dimly can I see
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The helmeted Valkyries close to me.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Ten more I slay! How strange the thought of fear,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: With Woden's mounted messengers so near!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The darkness comes; I feel my spirit rise;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: A kind Valkyrie bears me to the skies.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: With conscience clear, I quit the earth below,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The boundless joys of Woden's halls to know.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The grove of Glasir soon shall I behold,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And on Valhalla's tablets be enroll'd:
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: There to remain, till Heimdall's horn shall sound,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And Ragnarok enclose creation round;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And Bifrost break beneath bold Surtur's horde,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And Gods and men fall dead beneath the sword;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: When sun shall die, and sea devour the land,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And stars descend, and naught but Chaos stand.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Then shall Alfadur make his realm anew,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And Gods and men with purer life indue.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: In that blest country shall Abundance reign,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Nor shall one vice or woe of earth remain.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Then, not before, shall men their battles cease,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And live at last in universal peace.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Through cloudless heavens shall the eagle soar,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And happiness prevail forevermore.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Last of the giants, in whose soul shone clear
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The sacred torch of greatness and of right,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: A stricken world, that cannot boast thy peer,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Mourns o'er thy grave amidst the new-born night.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Sage, seer and statesman, wise in ev'ry art;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: First to behold, and first to preach, the truth;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Soldier and patriot, in whose mighty heart
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Throbb'd the high valour of eternal youth.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Foremost of citizens and best of chiefs,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Within thy mind no weak inaction lay;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Leal to thy standards, firm in thy beliefs;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: As quick to do, as others are to say.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Freeman and gentleman, whose spirit glow'd
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: With kindness' and with goodness' warmest fire;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: To prince and peasant thy broad friendship flow'd,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Each proud to take, and eager to admire.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Within thy book of life each spotless page
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Lies open for a world's respecting view;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Thou stand'st the first and purest of our age,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: To private, as to public virtue true.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: In thee did such transcendent greatness gleam,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: That none might grudge thee an Imperial place;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Yet such thy modesty, thou need'st must seem
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The leader, not the monarch, of thy race.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Courage and pow'r, to wit and learning join'd,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: With energy that sham'd the envious sun;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The ablest, bravest, noblest of mankind--
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: A Caesar and Aurelius mixt in one.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: At thy stern gaze Dishonour bow'd its head;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Oppression slunk ingloriously away;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The virtuous follow'd where thy footsteps led,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And Freedom bless'd thy uncorrupted sway.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: When from the East invading Vandals pour'd,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And selfish ignorance restrain'd our hand,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Thy voice was first to bid us draw the sword
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: To guard our liberties and save our land.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Envy deny'd thee what thy spirit sought,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And held thee from the battle-seething plain;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Yet thy proud blood in filial bodies fought,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And poppies blossom o'er thy QUENTIN slain.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: 'Twas thine to see the triumph of thy cause;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Thy grateful eyes beheld a world redeem'd;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Would that thy wisdom might have shap'd the laws
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Of the new age, and led to heights undream'd!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Yet art thou gone? Will not thy presence cling
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Like that of all the great who liv'd before?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Will not new wonders of thy fashioning
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Rise from thy words, as potent as of yore?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Absent in flesh, thou with a brighter flame
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Shin'st as the beacon of the brave and free;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Thou art our country's soul--our loftiest aim
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Is but to honour and to follow thee!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: But the features of Americanism peculiar to this continent must not be
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: belittled. In the abolition of fixed and rigid class lines a distinct
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: people beneath. Thus opportunities of the choicest sort await every

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: to genuine Americanism shall be fully impressed upon the people, it is
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The main struggle which awaits Americanism is not with reaction, but
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: iconoclasm, and abounds with shrewd sophists who use the name
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: devising anything better.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: The White Ship
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Howard Phillips Lovecraft
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: I am Basil Elton, keeper of the North Point light that my father and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: grandfather kept before me. Far from the shore stands the grey
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: lighthouse, above sunken slimy rocks that are seen when the tide is low,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: but unseen when the tide is high. Past that beacon for a century have
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: swept the majestic barques of the seven seas. In the days of my
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: grandfather there were many; in the days of my father not so many; and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: now there are so few that I sometimes feel strangely alone, as though I
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: were the last man on our planet.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: From far shores came those white-sailed argosies of old; from far
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Eastern shores where warm suns shine and sweet odours linger about
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: strange gardens and gay temples. The old captains of the sea came often
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: to my grandfather and told him of these things, which in turn he told to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: my father, and my father told to me in the long autumn evenings when
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the wind howled eerily from the East. And I have read more of these
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: things, and of many things besides, in the books men gave me when I was
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: young and filled with wonder.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: But more wonderful than the lore of old men and the lore of books is the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: secret lore of ocean. Blue, green, grey, white or black; smooth,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ruffled, or mountainous; that ocean is not silent. All my days have I
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: watched it and listened to it, and I know it well. At first it told to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: me only the plain little tales of calm beaches and near ports, but with
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the years it grew more friendly and spoke of other things; of things
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: more strange and more distant in space and in time. Sometimes at
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: twilight the grey vapours of the horizon have parted to grant me
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: glimpses of the ways beyond; and sometimes at night the deep waters of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the sea have grown clear and phosphorescent, to grant me glimpses of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ways beneath. And these glimpses have been as often of the ways that
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: were and the ways that might be, as of the ways that are; for ocean is
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: more ancient than the mountains, and freighted with the memories and the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: dreams of Time.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: was full and high in the heavens. Out of the South it would glide very
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: smoothly and silently over the sea. And whether the sea was rough or
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: calm, and whether the wind was friendly or adverse, it would always
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: glide smoothly and silently, its sails distent and its long strange
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: tiers of oars moving rhythmically. One night I espied upon the deck a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ever did he beckon me.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: walked out over the waters to the White Ship on a bridge of moonbeams.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: seemed to know well, and the hours were filled with soft songs of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: oarsmen as we glided away into a mysterious South, golden with the glow
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of that full, mellow moon.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: far lands, bright and beautiful, and to me unknown. Up from the sea rose
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: nearer the green shore the bearded man told me of that land, the Land of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: once and then are forgotten. And when I looked upon the terraces again I
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: L. Theobald, Jun.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Before our sight your mobile face
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Depicts your joys or woes distracting;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: We marvel at your winsome grace--
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And wish you'd learn the art of acting!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Your eyes, we vow, surpass the stars;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Your mouth is like the bow of Cupid;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Your rose-ting'd cheeks no wrinkle mars--
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Yet why are you so sweetly stupid?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The hero views you with delight,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: To win your hand forever working;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: We pity him--the witless wight--
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: To fall a victim to your smirking!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And yet, why should we wail in rhyme
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Because so crudely you dissemble?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: We can't expect for one small dime,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: To see a Woffington or Kemble!
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: complex; but suspense, and climactic progress from one incident to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: another, are essential. Every incident in a fictional work should have
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: Unity, Mass, Coherence
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: In developing a theme, whether descriptive or narrative, it is necessary
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: that three structural qualities be present: Unity, Mass, and Coherence.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Unity is that principle whereby every part of a composition must have
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: some bearing on the central theme. It is the principle which excludes
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: all extraneous matter, and demands that all threads converge toward the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: climax. Classical violations of Unity may be found in the =episodes= of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Homer and other epic poets of antiquity, as well as in the digressions
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of Fielding and other celebrated novelists; but no beginner should
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: venture to emulate such liberties. Unity is the quality we have lately
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: noted and praised in Poe and Bierce.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Mass is that principle which requires the more important parts of a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: composition to occupy correspondingly important places in the whole
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: composition, the paragraph, and the sentence. It is that law of taste
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: which insists that emphasis be placed where emphasis is due, and is most
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: strikingly embodied in the previously mentioned necessity for an
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: emphatic ending. According to this law, the end of a composition is its
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: most important part, with the beginning next in importance.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Coherence is that principle which groups related parts together and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: keeps unrelated parts removed from one another. It applies, like Mass,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: to the whole composition, the paragraph, or the sentence. It demands
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: that kindred events be narrated without interruption, effect following
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: cause in a steady flow.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Forms of Composition
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Few writers succeed equally in all the various branches of literature.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: that form which best fits his particular personality. Many, however,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: or points of view.

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: none but Nyarlathotep dare prophesy, and that in the sputter of his
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: sparks there was taken from men that which had never been taken before
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: yet which shewed only in the eyes. And I heard it hinted abroad that
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: those who knew Nyarlathotep looked on sights which others saw not.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: It was in the hot autumn that I went through the night with the restless
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: crowds to see Nyarlathotep; through the stifling night and up the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: endless stairs into the choking room. And shadowed on a screen, I saw
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: hooded forms amidst ruins, and yellow evil faces peering from behind
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: fallen monuments. And I saw the world battling against blackness;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: against the waves of destruction from ultimate space; whirling,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: churning; struggling around the dimming, cooling sun. Then the sparks
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: played amazingly around the heads of the spectators, and hair stood up
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: on end whilst shadows more grotesque than I can tell came out and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: squatted on the heads. And when I, who was colder and more scientific
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: than the rest, mumbled a trembling protest about "imposture" and "static
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: electricity," Nyarlathotep drave us all out, down the dizzy stairs into
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the damp, hot, deserted midnight streets. I screamed aloud that I was
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: _not_ afraid; that I never could be afraid; and others screamed with me
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: for solace. We sware to one another that the city _was_ exactly the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: same, and still alive; and when the electric lights began to fade we
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: cursed the company over and over again, and laughed at the queer faces
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: we made.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: I believe we felt something coming down from the greenish moon, for when
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: we began to depend on its light we drifted into curious involuntary
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: marching formations and seemed to know our destinations though we dared
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: not think of them. Once we looked at the pavement and found the blocks
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: loose and displaced by grass, with scarce a line of rusted metal to show
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: where the tramways had run. And again we saw a tram-car, lone,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: windowless, dilapidated, and almost on its side. When we gazed around
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the horizon, we could not find the third tower by the river, and noticed
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: that the silhouette of the second tower was ragged at the top. Then we
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: split up into narrow columns, each of which seemed drawn in a different
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: direction. One disappeared in a narrow alley to the left, leaving only
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the echo of a shocking moan. Another filed down a weed-choked subway
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: entrance, howling with a laughter that was mad. My own column was sucked
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: toward the open country, and presently felt a chill which was not of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: hot autumn: for as we stalked out on the dark moor, we beheld around us
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the hellish moon-glitter of evil snows. Trackless, inexplicable snows,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: swept asunder in one direction only, where lay a gulf all the blacker
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: for its glittering walls. The column seemed very thin indeed as it
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: plodded dreamily into the gulf. I lingered behind, for the black rift in
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the green-litten snow was frightful, and I thought I had heard the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: reverberations of a disquieting wail as my companions vanished; but my
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: power to linger was slight. As if beckoned by those who had gone before,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: I half-floated between the titanic snowdrifts, quivering and afraid,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: into the sightless vortex of the unimaginable.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Screamingly sentient, dumbly delirious, only the gods that were can
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: tell. A sickened, sensitive shadow writhing in hands that are not hands,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: and whirled blindly past ghastly midnights of rotting creation, corpses
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of dead worlds with sores that were cities, charnel winds that brush the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: pallid stars and make them flicker low. Beyond the worlds vague ghosts
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of monstrous things; half-seen columns of unsanctified temples that rest
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: on nameless rocks beneath space and reach up to dizzy vacua above the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: spheres of light and darkness. And through this revolving graveyard of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the universe the muffled, maddening beating of drums, and thin,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: monotonous whine of blasphemous flutes from inconceivable, unlighted
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: chambers beyond Time; the detestable pounding and piping whereunto dance
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: slowly, awkwardly and absurdly the gigantic, tenebrous ultimate
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: gods--the blind, voiceless, mindless gargoyles whose soul is
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Editorial
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Editorial comment upon amateur journalism generally falls within one of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: two classes; complacent self-congratulation upon a mythical perfection,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: or hectic urging toward impossible achievements. It is our purpose this
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: month to indulge in neither of these rhetorical recreations, but to make
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: one very prosaic and practical appeal which springs solely from
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: realistic observation.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: This appeal concerns the official situation in the United. For several
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: years our foes have reproached us for excessive centralisation of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: authority: asserting that the control of our society is anything from
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: oligarchical to monarchial, and pointing to the large amount of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: influence wielded by a very few leaders. Denials on our part, prompted
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: by the conspicuous absence of any dictatorial ambitions in the minds of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: our executives, have been largely nullified by the fact that while power
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: has not been autocratically usurped and arbitrarily exercised, the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: burden of administrative work has certainly been thrust by common
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: consent on a small number of reluctant though loyal shoulders. A few
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: persons have been forced to retain authority because no others have
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: arisen to relieve them of their burdens, until official nominations have
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: come to mean no more than a campaign by one or two active spirits to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: persuade certain patient drudges to "carry on" another year. Nor does
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the formal official situation reflect all of the prevailing condition.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Much of the Association's most important activity, such as recruiting,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: welcoming and criticism, verges into the field of unorganised effort;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: and here the tendency to leave everything to a narrow group is
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: overwhelming.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Obviously, this condition demands a remedy; and that remedy lies in one
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: direction only--an acceptance of potential official responsibility by
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: all of those members who possess the time and experience to act as
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: leaders. As the fiscal year progresses, the season for candidacies draws
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: near; and amateurs who feel competent to sustain their share of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: administrative burden should come forward as nominees, or at least
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: should respond when approached by their friends. That office-holding
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: involves tedious work, all admit, but this tedium is a small enough
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: price to pay for the varied boons of amateurdom. In unofficial labour an
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: equal willingness should be shown. Why is it that all the private
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: revision in the United is performed by about three men at most, despite
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the presence in our ranks of a full score of scholars abundantly capable
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of rendering such service? If the _literati_ as a whole will not awaken
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: to the needs of the day, one of two things will occur. The United will
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: stagnate quietly under the perpetual dictatorship of a limited group of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: unwilling but benevolent autocrats, or it will succumb to the onslaught
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of some political clique of vigorous barbarians who will destroy in a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: month what it has taken the United over ten years to build up. Memories
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of 1919 should prove to us the reality of such a danger of sudden
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: relapse.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Our appeal, then, is for responsible candidates for high office, and for
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: volunteers in the work of maintaining interest and lending literary aid.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: We know that executive energy and enthusiasm tend to be more abundant in
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the Goth than in the Greek; that those best qualified to serve are
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: generally least moved by political ambition. But we are sure that the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: needs of our society should arouse enough sense of duty among its
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: cultivated membership to draw to the front a new generation of leaders.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: We ask for new presidential and editorial candidates who are prepared to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: serve faithfully and independently if elected; for new critics and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: recruiters who understand our traditions and are willing to expend
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: energy in upholding and diffusing them. Shall 1921 bring them to light?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: WARD PHILLIPS
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: When the last days were upon me, and the ugly trifles of existence began
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: to drive me to madness like the small drops of water that torturers let
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: fall ceaselessly upon one spot of their victim's body, I loved the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: irradiate refuge of sleep. In my dreams I found a little of the beauty I
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: had vainly sought in life, and wandered through old gardens and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: enchanted woods.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Once when the wind was soft and scented I heard the south calling, and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: sailed endlessly and languorously under strange stars.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Once when the gentle rain fell I glided in a barge down a sunless stream
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: under the earth till I reached another world of purple twilight,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: iridescent arbours and undying roses.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And once I walked through a golden valley that led to shadowy groves and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ruins, and ended in a mighty wall green with antique vines, and pierced
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: by a little gate of bronze.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Many times I walked through that valley, and longer and longer would I
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: pause in the spectral half-light where the giant trees squirmed and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: twisted grotesquely, and the grey ground stretched damply from trunk to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: trunk, sometimes disclosing the mould-stained stones of buried temples.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: And always the goal of my fancies was the mighty vine-grown wall with
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the little gate of bronze therein.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: After a while, as the days of waking became less and less bearable from
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: their greyness and sameness, I would often drift in opiate peace through
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the valley and the shadowy groves, and wonder how I might seize them for
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: my eternal dwelling-place, so that I need no more crawl back to a dull
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: world stript of interest and new colours. And as I looked upon the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: little gate in the mighty wall, I felt that beyond it lay a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: dream-country from which, once it was entered, there would be no return.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: So each night in sleep I strove to find the hidden latch of the gate in
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the ivied antique wall, though it was exceedingly well-hidden. And I
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: would tell myself that the realm beyond the wall was not more lasting
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: merely, but more lovely and radiant as well.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Then one night in the dream-city of Zakarion I found a yellowed papyrus
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: filled with the thoughts of dream-sages who dwelt of old in that city,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: and who were too wise ever to be born in the waking world. Therein were
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: written many things concerning the world of dream, and among them was
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: lore of a golden valley and a sacred grove with temples, and a high wall
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: pierced by a little bronze gate. When I saw this lore, I knew that it
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: touched on the scenes I had haunted, and I therefore read long in the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: yellowed papyrus.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Some of the dream-sages wrote gorgeously of the wonders beyond the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: irrepassable gate, but others told of horror and disappointment. I knew
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: not which to believe, yet longed more and more to cross forever into the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: unknown land; for doubt and secrecy are the lure of lures, and no new
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: horror can be more terrible than the daily torture of the commonplace.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: So when I learned of the drug which would unlock the gate and drive me
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: through, I resolved to take it when next I awaked.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Last night I swallowed the drug and floated dreamily into the golden
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: valley and the shadowy groves; and when I came this time to the antique
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: wall, I saw that the small gate of bronze was ajar. From beyond came a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: glow that weirdly lit the giant twisted trees and tops of the buried
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: temples, and I drifted on songfully, expectant of the glories of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: land from whence I should never return.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: But as the gate swung wider and the sorcery of drug and dream pushed me
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: through, I knew that all sights and glories were at an end; for in that
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: new realm was neither land nor sea, but only the white void of unpeopled
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: and illimitable space. So, happier than I had ever dared hope to be, I
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: dissolved again into that native infinity of crystal oblivion from which
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the daemon Life had called me for one brief and desolate hour.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)
