text: INFORMATION
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Amateur Journalism is for those who cultivate literature from taste or
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: attachment, for those who write for the love of writing, for those who
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: pursue the art of letters for its own sake. They may or may not be
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: engaged (or aspire to be engaged) in authorship as a business, but those
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: who are members of that profession will undoubtedly find in Amateur
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Journalism the air of freedom which develops personality in writing.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: They will find every encouragement to self-development, amid an
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: environment of art. Amateur Journalism is for all those who do literary
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: work for the love of it."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "The privileges of the United Amateur Press Association are: The use of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the Manuscript Bureau and the columns of the papers connected with the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Association; the Official Organ; attendance at Conventions; proxy
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: representation at elections; laureate competitions, etc."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Any person who edits or contributes prose or poetry to any amateur
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: paper is eligible to membership."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Application for membership must be accompanied by one dollar dues and a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: printed or written credential.... If rejected, dues will be returned."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Renewal or reinstatement fee is two dollars."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Applicants for membership should address their applications, with
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: credential and dues, to the Secretary, Miss Alma B. Sanger, 667 Lilley
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Ave., Columbus, Ohio."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Any person wishing to become connected with the Association without
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: furnishing a credential or becoming active, may upon payment of two
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: dollars be enrolled as a sustaining member for one year. A sustaining
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: member shall be entitled to all the privileges of active membership
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: except the right to vote or hold office."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Laureate entries shall be poem, story, essay and editorial."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: "Entries must be printed in an amateur paper, and a marked copy sent to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the Laureate Recorder by June 1."
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Anyone desiring application blanks for recruiting may receive them by
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: applying to the Secretary.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: IMPORTANT
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Members are urged to remember the recent doubling of dues, whereby all
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: renewals became _Two Dollars_ each.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The fullest of apologies is due the membership for the lateness of this
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: issue of THE UNITED AMATEUR. A prostrating and overwhelming flood of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: professional duties, coupled with a state of health permitting only the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: shortest of working hours, has forced the editor to delay transmission
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of this copy to the publisher until November 4: a date which should be
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: remembered in justice to the latter official, who is equally handicapped
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: in the matter of conflicting duties.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: THE EDITOR
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Editorial
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: In the excellent October _Woodbee_, Mr. Leo Fritter criticises with much
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: force the attempt of the present editor to conduct THE UNITED AMATEUR on
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: a tolerably civilised plane. He points out that the appearance of a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: journal representing a fairly uniform maturity of thought and artistic
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: development may perhaps tend to discourage those newer aspirants who
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: have not yet attained their full literary stature, and thus defeat the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: educational ends of the Association.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Mr. Fritter gathers his material for complaint from the opinions of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: certain amateurs with whom he has held communication, and on this basis
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: alleges a "wide-spreading dissatisfaction" with the present editorial
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: policy. We have ourselves received numerous and enthusiastic assurances
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of an opposite nature, especially since the Fritter attack, so that we
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: must rebut at least his charge that we are ignoring the membership's
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: wishes and "trying to conform them to a mould we have arbitrarily cast
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: according to ideas of our own." To adopt a lower standard would, indeed,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: be affronting a more influential element than that which may at present
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: be dissatisfied; an element which has possibly gained higher claims to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: consideration through the _continuous_ nature of its services to the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Association during trying times when others were silent and inactive.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: But in determining the question of editorial policy, the abstract merits
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of the case are more important than the act of pleasing this or that
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: person or group. Were we convinced that the existing order hampered the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: sincere novice, we would abandon it without pride or ceremony. That we
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: do not, is because we are certain that retrogression and decadence would
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: constitute a fatal mistake. The public we serve is assumed to be a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: genuinely progressive one, a group bent upon attaining some measure of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: proficiency in that sincere self-expression which is art. If it were
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: not, it would have joined some other association of different
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: purposes--the defiantly crude Erford pseudo-United or the complacently
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: social and stationary National. What justifies the separate existence
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: and support of the United is its higher aesthetic and intellectual cast;
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: its demand for the unqualified best as a goal--which demand, by the way,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: must not be construed as discriminating against even the crudest
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: beginner who honestly cherishes that goal. With these objects in mind,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: it will be seen that the self-satisfied exultation of the superficial,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the obvious, the commonplace, and the conventional, would form the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: greatest possible tactical error. The goal would be unjustifiably
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: obscured, and the aspiration of the membership stunted, through the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: enshrining of a false and inferior goal--a literary Golden Calf. We must
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: envisage a genuine scale of values, and possess a model of genuine
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: excellence toward which to strive. It would pay better to work toward a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: high standard oneself, than to seek to drag the standard down to fit
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: whatever particular grade of ignorance one may happen to have at a given
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: moment. With proper effort any member may eventually produce work of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: UNITED AMATEUR grade, and such work will be certain of a cordial welcome
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: in this office. The official organ is not so narrow as it seems; if more
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of our capable members would favour it with their literary
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: contributions, the range of authors represented would not be so
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: restricted. It is not the editor but the body of our _literati_ who must
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: bear responsibility for the constant reappearance of certain names. This
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: issue is headed by the same poet who headed the last two--but only
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: because another eminent amateur, so far unrepresented during the present
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: regime, utterly ignored our repeated requests for a contribution.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Mr. Fritter--who, I fear, wrongs etymology in his acceptance of the word
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: _amateur_ as meaning a tyro rather than a genuine and disinterested
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: artist--forgets that a relapse to cruder standards would totally unfit
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the United for serving that staunch element which has contributed most
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: to its present welfare. Many would find a society of the lower grade
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: intolerable; certainly it could not hope to hold the very ones who have
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: given this organization its existing distinctiveness and pre-eminence.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Yet in the arguments of Mr. Fritter there is an underlying soundness
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: which misapplication should not obscure to the analytical reader. He is
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: right in lamenting, as we believe he does, the absence of a suitable
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: publishing medium for the work of our younger writers. It is not in a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: spirit of affront to him that we give preference to the plan of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: President Haughton, as outlined in her opening message, for the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: re-establishment of a special magazine for credentials. We should be
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: glad to curtail the official organ in the interest of such a magazine,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: as indeed we offered to do at the beginning of the term.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: _Frustra laborat_, says the old proverb, _qui omnibus placere studet_.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: We regret that any one policy must of necessity displease a few members,
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: yet do not see how any improvement could be effected by making a change
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: which would merely shift the displeasure to another and even more
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: continuously industrious group. It is significant that the Gothic party
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: have no editorial candidate of their own to offer, so that the thankless
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: and toilsome office has been forced upon one whose indifferent health
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: makes it an almost unbearable burden to him. The question is one which
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: should ultimately be decided at the polls, each party putting forward a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: nominee who can be depended upon to fulfil its mandates. Meanwhile the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: present editor, whose sincere beliefs and policies were fully known long
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: before his unopposed election, stands ready to resign most cheerfully
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: whenever a suitable successor can be found. Bitterness, division and
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: personalities must be avoided at any cost, and we may be reckoned as a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: supporter of THE UNITED AMATEUR under any editor and policy.

text: Amidst the prevailing efforts of a small but pugnacious group to "liven"
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: up the United through attacks on the Official Organ, a few basic
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: principles should be remembered by those who stand in bewilderment.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Our constitution does not define the functions of THE UNITED AMATEUR
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: beyond making imperative the publication of certain official documents.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The rest is left to an unwritten combination of tradition and editorial
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: judgment. Any editor, once elected, is absolutely in control of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: magazine aside from the essential official matter; his only external
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: obligation being a tacit recognition of the prevailing objects of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Association. In the present case a narrow circle of agitators seems to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: be seeking political capital by accusing the editor of placing too high
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: an estimate on the membership and purposes of the United.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Since the whole development of the Association is involved in this
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: matter, it is important that a prompt and perfect understanding be
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: reached. The opinions of all members should be known, and if the editor
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: finds that he has been in error, he will be glad to arrange for the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: accommodation of the Organ to the wishes of the majority. Up to the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: present time, despite the florid overstatements of the few who are
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: trying to work up a new and wholly artificial dissatisfaction, this
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: office has received _not so much as one complaint_ as to policy save
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: from the two politicians who are seeking to lower the United's
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: standards. Endorsements as to the existing policy have been many, and as
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: long as these remain so tremendously in the Majority, it would be a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: betrayal of trust to make a change to please a tiny group. If there are
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: those who differ, why do they not speak?
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Since truth is the only perfect clarifier when politics seeks to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: becloud, it is necessary that the editor state his policy here and now
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: with the utmost candour. Shorn of all irrelevant things, that policy is
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: simply the maintenance of those standards established in the United by
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the departure of the chronically political element in 1912. Prior to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: that time the Official Organ was mainly a bulletin of reports: not, as
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the present agitators would imply, a repository for indiscriminate
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: amateur writings. The standard developed since then is the creation of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: no one person, but a logical outgrowth of the rising calibre of a vital
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: and progressive society. It is neither one of favouritism nor one of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: autocracy; but merely one of _stimulation_. It is an embodiment of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: United's desire to let the Official Organ exemplify the members'
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: progress by using the best available material. No genuine aspirant has
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: ever been frowned upon, or so far as we know given any ground for
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: discouragement. The Organ is a beckoner and encourager, designed to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: inspire the members to renewed efforts to produce work worthy of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: symbolising the United. Would anyone so far insult the Association as to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: wish its official exponent to cater to that type of mediocrity which
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: neither improves nor wishes to improve? Our columns are open to all who
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: toil for the fruits of art, and statements to the contrary cannot be
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: interpreted as other than irresponsibly ignorant or craftily
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: misrepresentative. While insistence on a certain degree of merit is of

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: course necessary, it is not true that THE UNITED AMATEUR makes any
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: arbitrary restrictions. The Organ was not designed for the publication
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: of various members' work, nor is access to its columns one of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: special objects of membership, as certain agitators are artfully
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: intimating. But notwithstanding those technical points, all proficient

author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: writers are welcome. It is illuminating, in view of the prevalent loose
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: statements, to reflect that throughout the present editor's service _not

title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922

text: FRANK BELKNAP LONG, JR.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: The home of Poe! It is like a fairy dwelling, a gnomic palace built of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the aether of dreams. It is tiny and delicate and lovely, and replete
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: with memories of sere leaves in November and of lilies in April. It is a
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: castle of vanished hopes, of dimly-remembered dreams, of sad memories
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: older than the deluge. The dead years circle slowly and solemnly around
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: its low white walls, and clothe it in a mystic veil of unseen tears. And
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: many marvellous stories could this quaint little old house tell, many
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: weird and cryptic stories of him of the Raven hair, and high, pallid
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: brow, and sad, sweet face, and melancholy mien; and of the beloved
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: Virginia, that sweet child of a thousand magic visions, child of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: lonesome, pale-gray latter years, child of the soft and happy South. And
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: how the dreamer of the spheres must have loved this strange little
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: house. Every night the hollow boards of its porch must have echoed to
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: his footfall, and every morn the great rising sun must have sent its
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: rays through the little window, and bathed the lovely tresses of the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: dream-child in mystical yellow. And perhaps there was laughter within
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the walls of that house--laughter and merriment and singing. But we know
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: that the Evil One came at last, the grim humourless spectre who loves
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: not beauty, and is not of this world. And we know that the house of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: youth and of love became a house of death, and that memories bitter as
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: the tears of a beautiful woman assailed the dreamer within. And at last
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: he himself left that house of mourning and sought solace among the
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: stars. But the house remains a vision out of a magical book; a thing
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: seen darkly as in a looking-glass; but lovely beyond the dreams of
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)

text: mortals, and ineffably sad.
title: Writings in the United Amateur, 1915-1922
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips)
